41 ¶ Vita sancti Dominici confessoris.
SEint Domenic, þe holie frere : in spayne was i-bore,
In þe toune of Caylre— : wel guod was þe more:
Sire felice is fader het : is moder dame Ione.
glad was þe Moder of þe sone : þat for him gan ofte grone.
Þeo &yogh;wile þat þis holie child : in is Moder wombe was,
hire þou&yogh;te, ase heo lay a-slepe : ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas,
þat heo bar in hire wombe a best : þat faireste in any lond,
And þat best bar ri&yogh;t in is Mouth : ane berninde brond;
þe brond in þusse bestes mouth : þo it was of hire i-bore,
Schon so þat al cristine-dom : þe bri&yogh;tore was þare-fore,
And so wide so was cristinedom : And þare was so deork so ny&yogh;t
þe brond in þe bestes Mouþe : hire þou&yogh;te &yogh;af gret li&yogh;t.
þo þat child was i-bore : and i-brou&yogh;t to cristin-dom,
Al-so bi-feol þat a guod lauedi : þat him of watere nam,
þou&yogh;te þat þare was a steorre : In his fore-heued so bri&yogh;t,
þat þoru-out al cristine-dom : schon and &yogh;af gret lij&yogh;t.
&YOGH;wat was þis schiningue of þis child : bote þat he scholde bringue
to godes lawe Mani a man : þoru&yogh; is guode prechingue,
And þat he scholde an ordre make : of frere prechours, þat &yogh;et is;
þat þare-þoru&yogh; al cristine-dom : a-mendi scholde, i-wis?
þis child, þeo &yogh;wyle it was &yogh;ong : to guode drou&yogh; a-non,
to fastingue and to almes-dede : and wolle werie[Vern. wolleward] to gon;
In is bedde he nolde beo : bote wel luyte stounde,
Ake ligge in is oresones : op-on þe harde grounde.
þo he was sethþe to scole i-set : a deore &yogh;er þare cam:
his bokes he solde and al is guod : and alle þe panes he nam
And delde heom alle to pouere men : ant ne lefde him-sulf ri&yogh;t no&yogh;t.
þe tyþingue of is godhede : was sone wide i-brou&yogh;t:
So þat þe bischop of þe lond : louede him wel i-nou&yogh;
And enqueorede of is dedes : þat to alle guode he drou&yogh;:
hei&yogh; man he made him sone : and chanun seculer—
Wel luyte tolde þe holie Man : of is grete power.
Þare weren false cristine Men : a-boute in þe londe,
þat nolden nou&yogh;t clanliche : þe ri&yogh;te bi-leue onder-stonde,
Ne huy ne bi-lefden nou&yogh;t þat ore louerd were i-bore : of þe maide Marie—
Swuch manere fals bi-leue : Men cleopeden heresie.
A-&yogh;ein heom þis holie man : despuytede alday faste,
And manie of heom þoru&yogh; godes grace : into ri&yogh;te bi-leue heom caste.
An Eorl þare was in þe londe þo : þat guod Man was i-nou&yogh;:
Sire Symon de Mountfort : þat to alle guodnesse drou&yogh;,
his fader þat was here a-slawe : a-mong us in Engelonde
Atþe batayle of Euesham : þat longue worth onder-stonde.
Þis guode kny&yogh;t sire Symon : strong kny&yogh;t was i-nou&yogh;
And a-&yogh;ein þis vuele cristine Men : to batayle al day he drou&yogh;.
Seint Domenic al-so a-boute &yogh;eode : and prechede a&yogh;ein heom wel faste:
So þat þis tweye guode Men : to-gadere heore heorte caste,
Þat huy weren boþe at one rede : þe on with his prechingue,
Þe oþur with strencþe of bataille : þat folk to guode bringue.
And þe guode Erol[r. Eorl] syre symon : þe &yogh;wile is lijf i-laste,
Euere heold op with his power : seint Dompnic wel faste;
And þoru&yogh; is pouer muche-del : þe ordre he bi-gan
Of frere prechours, þat &yogh;eot is : for-to saui mani a man.—
bi-twene þis men for heore heresie : þe striuingue ofte was
And þe holie Manne seint Domenic. : ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas,
Op-on þe hul of vittorie : A day þare was i-nome
Of desputisun bi-tweone heom : and þo þe day was i-come,
Seint Domenic cam forth þo : and In a writ he brou&yogh;te
his resones for cristin-dom : and þis luþere Men it bi-tau&yogh;te,
to counseilie heom þare-upon bet : and Answerien þare-to
Oþur beon studefastore in heore bi-leue : bote huy heom couþen ondo.
þis Men of heore heresie : lou&yogh;wen þo wel smere;[A v. om.]
A gret fuyr huy maden a-non : and þat writ heo casten In þere,
And seiden, &yogh;if it barnde þo : of none vertue it nere.
Þat writ lay longue in þat fuyr : and neuere þe weorse it nas,
Ne nou&yogh;t i-wemned of one lette[r] : and þat was a fair cas!
Þo þe luþere Men i-seien þis : a-nuyde huy weren sore;
huy nomen þat bok and seiden a-non : þat huy wolden &yogh;eot fondi more:
huy casten eft-sone in-to þe fuyr : and þe þridde tyme al-so:
And euere þat writ was al-so sound : as it was þare-inne i-do.
þis Men of heore heresie : i-schende heom heolden þo—
And nolden nou&yogh;t &yogh;eot al clanliche : out of heore folie go.
Seint domenic þis holie Man : ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas,
In þe Cite of tolouse : ten &yogh;er to-gadere he was.
he þou&yogh;te bi-guynne a-godes name : &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te it bringue to ende,
An ordre of Men to prechi faste : and a-boute þe world to wende,
þat mi&yogh;ten þoru&yogh;-out cristindom : Men wissi and rede;
&YOGH;eorne he bad to Iesu crist : helpe him to þis dede.
So þat þe pope Innocent : a gret counseil I-nou&yogh;
Makede at rome þulke tyme : and muche folk þudere drou&yogh;.
Seint Domenic wel mildeliche : þudere gan to wende,
&YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te anie grace habbe : to bringue is ordre to ende.
he cam and bad þe pope leue : swuch þing for-to do.
þe pope makede him dauncherous : and nolde ensenti þer-to.
¶ A ni&yogh;t, as þe pope lai a-slepe : ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas,
him þou&yogh;te þat þe churche of rome : al a-doneward was
Of "seint Iohanes de lateran" : and as he lai þere
he lokede euere and al þat folk : &yogh;wane huy ouer-falle were;
And seint Domenic heold up a-&yogh;en : and faste schef with-oute,
Wal ant tymber he pulte a-&yogh;ein : and faste orn a-boute.
þe pope, þo he a-wok : In grete þou&yogh;te lay
&YOGH;wat þis bi-tocningue mi&yogh;te beo : þat he slepinde i-sai&yogh;.
he þou&yogh;te þat þe stat of holi churche : swuyþe i-febled were
And þat cristine-dom in Manie studes : in ri&yogh;t guod stat it nere,
And þat seint Domenic þoru&yogh; is ordre : hire scholde helpe a-rere
þoru&yogh; his prechingue wide in londe : cristine men to lere.
þe pope a-morewe sente aftur him : and grauntede him wel fawe
to maken is ordre a-godes name : and folk to guode drawe;
bote þat he[he on the margin.] heom scheowede is ruyle : to alle is cardinales þere,
And þat huy weren i-prouede guode : are huy i-confermede were.
So þat þe ordre of frere prechours : seint Domenic bi-gan þo,
þat hath i-saued wel mani a man : and &yogh;eot it schal wel mo.
clerkes huy onder-fenguen sone : þat þe Abite nome;
So þat euere mo and mo : freres þere bi-come.
SEint Domenic matte þo In a ni&yogh;t : þat seint petur him bi-tok
Ane staf, ase he cam to him : and seint powel ane bok.
Þo porueide he in is ordre : &yogh;wane freres wenden ouer lond,
to bere ane bok at heore rugges : and ane staf in heore hond.
Sethþe him þou&yogh;te a-slepe al-so : þat he sai&yogh; þe freres go
þoru&yogh; þe londe, two and two : and to-gadere non mo.
In-to Tolouse he wende þo : and bi-lefte him-sulf þere,
And sone[V. summe] he sente is freres a-boute : þat huy de-partet were;
In-to spaynne he sente some : and to paris al-so,
And þat þridde Couent to boloygne : heore ordre forth to do;
he het heom wende to and two : and prechi in þat lond,
At heore rugge bere ane bok : and ane staf in hore hond.
¶ A wonder sweuene seint Domenic : In his slep i-sei&yogh;:
Ore louerd him wrathþede swiþe : op in þe eyr an hei&yogh;,
þreo launcene he heold in is hond : þe poynt toward þe grounde,
Ri&yogh;t ase he wolde al þene world : þoru&yogh; smyte In one stounde;
So ferelich he was to bi-holde : þat it nas non ende.
þo cam ore leuedi li&yogh;te a-doun : þat is so milde and hende;
"A, mi sone," heo seide, "&yogh;wat þenest þou? : mcrci and þin ore!"
"I-nelle," seide ore louerd : "þis sunne : þolie more."
he seide, "al þis world is ful of sunne : and ful &yogh;are hath i-beo,
And þare-fore i-chulle al þene world a-sle : with þeose launces þreo."
Ore leuedi heold up hire hondene : and sat a-doun a-kneo,
And seide, "leoue sone, nouþe þin ore! : þov most þe bet bi-seo,
þou most þine wratþe mienge : with milce and with ore,
And þenche þat þou most milsful beo : And þat þou bou&yogh;test man ful sore."
"Moder," seide ore louerd þo : "hov mi&yogh;te ich don þi lore?
Ne sixtþou hou men me mis-doth : þat I-ne mai hit þolie more?"
"Leoue sone," ore lauedi seide : "a-bijd &yogh;eot one stounde:
Ich habbe ane guode Caumpiun : to þine bi-hofþe i-founde,
þat schal muche del of þat folk : onder þine wille do;
And anne felawe i-chulle him bi-take : þat schal helpe him þer-to."
"Lat me iseo," ore louerd seide : "i-chulle loki &yogh;weþer huy beon ou&yogh;tes."
Ore leuedi nam þo seint domenic : and bi-fore [ore] louerd him brou&yogh;te,
And seint Fraunceis al-so guod : "mi sone," heo seide, "lo
Mi chaumpiun and his felawe : þat schullen þis dede do."
"&YOGH;e," seide ore louerd, "þeos beoth boþe : strongue and guode þer-to :
I-chulle heom helpe in heore dedes : and &yogh;iue heom grace al-so."
¶ Seint Domenic a-morewe a-ros : ant to churche wende sone,
And on is sweuene þou&yogh;te muche : &yogh;wat him was to done.
he stod and bi-heold a-boute : his felawe he gan to[V. of] seo
þat ore lauedi him brou&yogh;te a-ni&yogh;t : is felawe for-to beo.
he ne hadde neuer er him i-sei&yogh;e : he descreuede him faste a-non,
his face and is bodi al-so : and[om. in V.] him þou&yogh;te it was swych on.
he tok and custe him a-non : ase it was wel ri&yogh;t,
And tolde him al[V. of al] þat cas : hov him matte a-ni&yogh;t;
And Eyþer bi-gan to schewi oþur : heore wille and heore þou&yogh;t;
So þat huy weren, ase god wolde : in o consent i-brou&yogh;t,
And eiþur dude bi oþeres rede : and þeos tweie ordres wrou&yogh;te,
Of frere prechours and of frere Menores : ase ore leuedi heom on brou&yogh;te :
¶ Seint Domenic þe ordre of frere prechours : ase ich habbe i-seid,
And seint Fraunceis of frere Menores : eiþer bi oþeres red.
And sire Symon de Mount-fort : þat guod kni&yogh;t was and hende,
Sosteinede þis holie Men : to bringue þis dede to ende.—
Ich wene, ich may for soþe it segge : &yogh;if huy nadden i-beo bi-founde,
þe world hadde for grete sune i-beo : are þis i-brou&yogh;t to grounde!
&YOGH;eot, for al þat heo mouwen a-boute go : to prechi and to schriue,
Sunne is &yogh;eot into al þis lond : and wrechhede, al-to riue!
here mouwen þis luþere men i-seo : þat euere spekez to quede,
In &yogh;wuche manere þis guode men : bi-gunne furst þis dede.
Manie of þis deoueles limes : bi-twene heom seggez al day&yogh; :
"Wel murie was þe world and guod : are man ani frere i-say&yogh;."
Al-so huy spekez, heom bi-fallez : for ore louerd seide, i-wis :
"bi þe fruyt man may i-seo : &yogh;wat-manere treo it is :
For þare ne may of no luyþur treo : no guod fruyt springue;"
vnneþe may a luyþur man ani guod word : out of him-sulue bringue.
huy mouwen loki &yogh;wanne ore louerd : heom smyt, harde i-nou&yogh;,
with one of his launces þreo : þat he to heom drou&yogh;,
þat was for þis tweie holie men : þulke tyme on-do;
Fondi heo mouwen heore wyþer-wine [&yogh;wan][om.] huy comiez þar-to.
Ake hit ne worth neuere fals : þat ore louerd him-self sede :
þat his desciples scholden i-blessede beo : &yogh;wanne men hem spekez to quede
And seggez heom scorn and bysemare : for ore louerdes name.
bi þe freres þus it is : of Men þat seggez heom schame;
Ake ore louerd him-sulf wole wreche nime : þei it were þo with-drawe
For seint Domenic þe holie Man : and seint Fraunceis, is felawe.—
þis holie Man seint dominic : In-to his ordre he nam
Ane &yogh;oungue clerk at one tyme : þat frere prechour bi-cam
And sethþe þoru&yogh; þe feondes lore : with-drou&yogh; him atþen-ende
And seide þat he wolde a-&yogh;ein : to þe worlde wende;
he dude of is Abite : and is schurte on him caste.
Seint Dominic sat a-doun a-kneo : and for him bad wel faste.
Ase he seide is oresones : þe clerk bi-gan to weopen sore
And pitou[s]liche bi-gan to crie : "a! nouþe merci, louerd, þin ore!
þis schurte[MS. schrurte] þat is a-boute me : for-brennez me to grounde;
Drawez hire of for godes loue : oþur ich deie in luyte stounde."
So þat þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace : him þou&yogh;te he was for-brent,
Are he nome a-&yogh;ein is Abite : and hadde is heorte i-wend.
BI a frere al-so at boloyne : bi-feol swych a cas
þat of þe feond i-fondet was : and with-inne him al-so he was.
Seint Domenic it of-þou&yogh;te sore : and het a-godes name
þene feond to helle wende a-non : and seide, "&yogh;wi dostþou me schuch schame?"
"þov ne þart me blamie nou&yogh;t : for with ri&yogh;te ich am here,"[Diaboius.]
þe feond Answerede seint Domenic : ase he was in þe frere,
"For þes frere cam &yogh;ursterday to toune : and dronk with-oute leue.
Ase a luyte mot þare-Inne ich lay : and bi-gan with-inne him weue;
For he ne blessede nou&yogh;t is drinke : and with-oute leue it nam,
Wit lawe ich mai in him beo : and with lawe in him ich am."
"Certes," seide þis frere, "he seith soth : and ri&yogh;t so it is.
Ichot, i dronk &yogh;urstai in toune : with-oute leue, i-wis,
And Ine blessede nou&yogh;t mi drinke : and a swuch mot þare was Inne,
And with þat drinke þat ich dronk : it schet me sone with-Inne.
Euer-eft he hath I-greued me. : ore louerd fram me him bringue!"
Ase huy tolden here-a-boute : to Matynes huy gonne ringue.
¶ "Out, out," quath þe deuel þo : "a-wei ich mot gon :
þis þeues with þis wide hodes : a-rise wollez a-non,
And I-ne dar nou&yogh;t a-bide heore song : adrad ich am wel sore."
he fleu out of þis selie man : and ne cam nei&yogh; him non-more.—
As þe holie man seint Domenic : and his felawes come
with-oute Tolouse bi a watur : ase huy hadden er i-lome,
heore bokes fullen into þe watur : and sonken a-non to grounde.
huy wenden forth in heore wei : þo huy ne mi&yogh;ten beon i-founde.
þare cam þane þridde day : a fischare with is ginne
And caste is nettes in þat watur. : þo felde he heui with-Inne.
þou&yogh;te he, "here is fisch i-nou&yogh;" : and bi-gan to drawe faste :
þe holie manness bokes it weren. : þo huy comen forth atþe laste,
Also sounde huy weren and druye : ase huy euerer were;
For al þat huy leien in þat watur : no-þing þe worse huy nere.—
¶ At one tyme seint Domenic : at rome was i-sete,
And fourti of is freres al-so : with him to þe mete.
huy nadden bote a luyte bred— : wel luyte was þe lestes,
And alle huy maden heom also Ioifole : ase huy weren at one feste.
Ake natheles huy weren of-hungrede sore : þei huy so glade were.
þo comen þare tweie children In : with wel milde chere;
Abite of freres huy hadden up-on : fairore neuere nere :
In heore lappene huy brou&yogh;ten mete : ant to seint Domenic hit bere.
þo huy hadden him þis mete i-take : huy nusten &yogh;ware huy bi-come.
þis freres maden heom glade I-nou&yogh; : and wordeliche forth it nome.—
¶ A dai, as þis holie Man : in þe Contreie we[n]de,
þat lodlokeste weder þat mi&yogh;te beo : ore louerd ouer him sende.
he bi-gan to maken is oresun : his felawe was in doute.
þat weder bi-gan to reinie faste : in eche side a-boute;
Ake sone it &yogh;af him roume[V. Ac hit bigon to &yogh;iue him] wei : and al-a-boute with-drawe,
þat bi fif fet it ne cam nou&yogh;t him nei&yogh; : ne al-so nei&yogh; his felawe.
BI-side þe Cite of Toluse bi a watur huy come.
A man ladde heom ouer In a schip : ase he dude oþere i-lome.
Seint Domenic wolde wende is wei : þo he to londe cam.
þe passour him het a-bide : and bi þe cope him nam,
And seide, he scholde him paye is huyre : were him leof þe loth,
he nolde him serui so for nou&yogh;t : and þarto he swor is oth.
"Lat me," seide þis holie Man : "par charite forth quijt gon,
And god wole &yogh;elden þi trauail : for i-ne habbe seoluer non."
"Al for nou&yogh;t," seide þes oþur : "bi þe fei þat i schal to þe,
Mi trauail þou schalt me paie : oþur þi cope bi-leue with me."
"&YOGH;wane þou nelt," quath þe holie man : "for godes loue nou&yogh;t do,
Ich bidde god, &yogh;if is wille beo : þat he helpe me þer-to."
þo lay bi-side þe schipe þere : a peni, fair I-nov&yogh;.
þe passour beu&yogh; a-doun a-non : and þane peni to him drou&yogh;.
"NIm þare," seide þis holie man : "ase ore louerd sende þe.
For i-nabbe mi-sulf nou&yogh;t : ore louerd a-quitez me."
Ore suete louerd nolde nou&yogh;t : þat þe freres i-lette were;
him-sulf he sende heom heore schip-huyre. : fair miracle was þere!—
¶ Al-so þis holie man a ni&yogh;t : In his oresones lay
bi him-sulf in priueite : ase he dude ni&yogh;t and day,
þe deuel cam and stod bi him : In Abite of frere.
"Womme," seide þe holie man : "&yogh;wat dost þov nouþe here?
&YOGH;wy nartþov In þine bedde a-slepe : In þe dortour with þine fere?
þov wost wel it nis nou&yogh;t ordre : ne non ri&yogh;t guod manere."
þe Deuel stod and made him signe : ase ho-so seith "i-nelle nou&yogh;t speke
Ne so muche mis-don a-&yogh;eines god : is ordre for-to breke."[V. has 2 vv. more.]
¶ Seint Domenic hadde wonder þar-of : &yogh;wat frere it mi&yogh;te beo
þat so wel is ordre heold. : he þou&yogh;te he wolde i-seo :
he wende and li&yogh;te ane candle : and bi-heold þis frere.
þo he wuste &yogh;wat he was : he þou&yogh;te &yogh;wat dost þou here;
he blamede him[MS. hẹiọm] suyþe muche : &yogh;wat he dude þo þere,
For it were betere is ri&yogh;te : þat he in helle were.
[diabolus.]¶ "þou mis-dest more," þe deuel seide : "þin ordre for-to breke :
For þou wost wel þis tyme : it ne fallez þe nou&yogh;t to speke."
[Dominicus.]¶ "þou ne seist nou&yogh;t ri&yogh;t," quath seint Domenic : "for þe prior may,
For-to wissi is &yogh;oungue freres : speken ni&yogh;t and day.
Ich hote þat þou me telle : nouþe þou art allingues here,

[Dominicus.]¶ "And &yogh;wat þe chapitle?" seint Domenic seide : "mi&yogh;t þou þare ou&yogh;t winne?"
[diabolus.]"A, beo stille," þe schrewe seide : "neuere Ine cam þare-Inne.
Longue, for þou it hast i-nemd : þe worse me schal beo.
God ne suffri me neuere þare-inne come : ne enes it i-seo!
Al þat ich habbe i-wonne a-day : and þe ni&yogh;t bi-fore,
Sone so þine freres þudere comieth : al ich habbe i-lore;
I-wyped it is al[V. as] clene a-wey : ase it neuere nere.
A-corsed is al þulke stude : ne come ich neuere þere."
þo wende þe schrewe is wei : and luyte hadde i-wonne,
And þe holie man is beden seide : ase he hadde bi-gonne.—
